capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I was reading about petunias the other day and it's really interesting to learn about their lineage. Apparently, they have this complex history with different species and cultivars that have been crossed over time. And what's even more fascinating is how their maculogy - which refers to the patterns on their leaves - can vary greatly depending on the specific variety. I mean, some petunias have these beautiful, intricate spots while others are almost completely solid in color. It's just amazing to think about all the different ways that nature can express itself through something as simple as a flower.
